metadata.title: CVE-2017-9119 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
The i_zval_ptr_dtor function in Zend/zend_variables.h in PHP 7.1.5 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and applicationcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering craftedoperations on array data structures.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.0-1
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.0-1
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.0-1
php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cli - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-common - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-curl - 8.1.0-1

php8.1-enchant - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.0-1

php8.1-gmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-imap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-interbase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-intl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-ldap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pspell - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-readline - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-snmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-soap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xml - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xsl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-zip - 8.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0-1').
